Cmb6FY4xw5TJ0kvgHF47Ew.text: Dinner was pretty good and the atmosphere was busy and buzzing. The views would be great on a nice day near the window, but we were closer to the entrance on a rainy day. Cocktails were really good but the food was hit and miss. Service was good as well.

LnGId65XJNbf05edJKpqRQ.text: The service sucks, the clientele is extremely uppity  for no particular reason (didnt appear to be the actual upper crust of society, just a bunch of posers) and the food and cocktails, while creatively planned, are  mediocrely  executed and outrageously priced.Still awesome. Stunning views, an aire of sophistication (albeit forced) and an experience to end your day / start your evening. During the summer, you can gaurantee that I pop in at least once during my gin fueled tours of mother London while "on business".Worth all the bullshit, but said BS is prevalent enough to effect the rating.

7hBS0PW97strMbBeiXeUww.text: You come here for the amazing views and the food is very good too.  The best dish had to be the dessert "house in the clouds". A tasting platter of various flavours to match a fine dark rum. A fun way to finish a meal, which definitely leaves your head in the clouds.One down side was the service was very stiff and formal.

56pTw4TKzjSAzFgGe1QURA.text: Great place to do an event, the views are amazing on a sunny day or a clear night. Big space, nice food. I have been twice and never felt disappointed.

NCQf4k_BKaV7WOCwqXq1Ug.text: definitely recommend this restaurant! Went with my family to celebrate my elder brother's birthday. The service is impeccable and the least bit stand-offish. (but do look nice as it's a dressy restaurant) Great modern European food- order the scallops app, John Dory fish, and the pork belly- and don't forget the strawberry soufflé. wonderful food, panorama view, and service. (oh and there were surprisingly quite a few families with younger children, albeit well-behaved and dressed nicely as well)

QFqpukkif2POQFFP5kMm4A.text: I can't think of a better restaurant to bring out-of-town friends visiting and celebrating a birthday. Oxo has it all - fantastic food, drinks, atmosphere and amazing views of the city. My girlfriend celebrating her 28th birthday and her first time in London was sooo ecstatic to be here. Such a great date spot too!

yFxMMewRnp8C-5XO1IUkow.text: I went here for a quick drink while walking along the south bank. Amazing views, probably the best you can get along the river! There's a balcony with tables where you can sit and have a drink while looking out over the London skyline. Just amazing. EDIT: apparently it is at the discretion of the manager on duty if you are allowed to order drinks and sit outside without making a reservation. Pretty harsh I would say, especially since the place was empty when I went the second time! Drinks are slightly pricey, but its expected due to the prime location of the bar. They also have a brasserie and a restaurant offering food, but I had a quick peek at the menu and it was really pricey!

W_p1JHj4xW_tDHk6DW84RA.text: Famously expensive, but that wasn't my experience.  I didn't eat, and just had a few cocktails.  They simply weren't that expensive.  £7 for a V&T and £6 for a large glass of wine is what you'll pay anywhere in London.The terrace has outstanding views, but on my visit was in a mess - abandoned glasses just sitting around, chairs all jumbled.  Come on Oxo Tower, this is why people come here.  Sort it out!

dfvQuEBAT1N3fwZKdkbz8g.text: I went to the OXO2, the 2nd floor venue that can be hired out to hold events on an open house night for events professionals. The views are absolutely magnificent. I don't know if a better location with views of London exists. The in house catering and drinks were pretty awful. The drinks were either too strong or too sweet and I honestly witnessed full grown adults making faces after sampling the food. While the presentation of the canapes were amazing, the flavours were missing.  Luckily they do not require you to use the in house catering so the venue has potential to be just want you want!With the right lighting and setup of tables, dancefloors, food, drinks etc... this would be a great venue. They wont quote you a flat rate until they hear what you want to do and then will make you a custom quote for your event.

skQH0VJPwajLiESK4IkYsw.text: Although the Oxo tower is famous; most people just know it as 'that posh restaurant on the river', and I have to admit I'd never really thought about what it might actually be like to dine there. So when I ascended the lift to the 8th floor I was suddenly quite nervous about what to expect and wondered what kind of experience lay in store (you normally at least know what cuisine the restaurant serves before you go, I suddenly realised I didn't even know that!). Would the Oxo tower's reputation turn out to be just based on hype or would it be well deserved? Anyway, I shouldn't have worried; what a wonderful evening it was. Although the food was good, the service was faultless! The waiters seemed to know what I wanted even before I did. As they had been fore-warned of my wife's gluten allergy they even had gluten-free bread warming in the oven without asking! At over 30 pages, the wine menu is overwhelming and will have something for every palette (and almost every wallet with prices between £30 and £15000!!) and the sommelier is on hand ready to offer suggestions to match your meal if you are struggling. My fillet of beef may have been the priciest thing on the menu, but it was worth every penny as every mouthwatering morsel was exquisite and satisfying (the first time I'd had beef served with marmalade, but oddly enough it works). I didn't really have room for my 'chocolate plate' but I couldn't resist the quartet of mini-puds and although my waistline may have been wincing, somehow every bite was finished. Of course, the view is fantastic overlooking the city skyline at night, but it's not as great as it could be from within the dining area, but if you are brave enough; take your table out on the balcony area - just take a layer or two as it's rather breezy up there! At £180 for two including wine, it's not somewhere you can go every week, but everyone should go at least once especially if you've started questioning waiting service standards recently in London - let the staff at Oxo restore your faith!

K9D8cRxO8R_LQVDQL2cDhg.text: Oxo tower is situated on the Southbank right next to the fun little Gabriel's Warf. Winning building of the year in 2007 for urban regeneration. This building helped rejuvenate the Southbank along with Tate Modern and the now relocated Saatchi Gallery.The views for the 8th Floor are spectacular. The lights of London in the evening are beautiful. The little boats on the Thames creeping up and down with onboard parties, dinner groups or tourists sightseeing.As you enter the 8th floor you first walk into the bar and brassiere area which is linked by an exquisite terrace to the restaurant.The seating in the Bar and brassiere is very intriguing. Large awkward shaped moulded plastic chairs. Extremely comfortable but exaggerated forms.The restaurant furniture is much simpler with sophisticated yet minimalistic tables and chairs. The huge glass facade is truly the finishing touch to this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

oX-8U3uSw20NXoI86NN8Xg.text: On the edge of London's great river, is a bizarrely shaped building, called the Oxo tower, and on top of it is the Oxo Tower Bar. I first went there because I heard that it was free to get the lift up the tower and catch a great view of London, and it is an amazing view. They said it was free, and that was really clever, and the view is magnetising and you almost feel that you have to toast to the moment, hence, a trip to the bar to purchase a drink.There is a bar and restaurant, and since my first trip, I have been a few more times, it is somewhere to take family visiting from abroad or take a lady friend. I havent had anything in the restaurant, but as for the Bar, it is expensive, but everything comes with good service and great views. My last trip there, I was on the Cocktails, me and a friend stayed and around four each, that cost me £50. Ok, its not cheap, but the view!!! I love it. If you arent afriad of heights, take a quick look from the outside balcony!!

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

ba_YnTFRkBH6mHPxvgc0gA.text: I once came here for a first date with someone, and even though he managed to drop his whole drink on me by mistake, I still thought the place was lovely.  The views from the tower are stunning, and the cocktails are delicious.  Fortunately the bar and restaurant area are separate, since the prices are rather high.  The restaurant obviously has the best views, but you can still catch a fully lit St. Paul's from a distance.  The bartenders were also very friendly and chatted with us as we drank our drinks.  There is a great variety of drinks on offer so you should ask the bartenders for recommendations, but this is a great place to go for a pleasant, yet slightly pricey cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

cSyDWU6GbXgtzIY52WKCLQ.text: A prominent architectural feature on the Southbanks, the Oxo is home to shops, businesses, offices and residential apartments. But what sets it apart, it faces the river Thames, is a good example to buildings reused. In this case originally built to house a power station; now its uses are multifunctional. One of the most famous restaurants is on the top floor 'The Oxo Tower Restaurant' run by Harvey Nichols. This restaurant has breathtaking views of the river-front and has an esteemed guest list. Bookings essential!!

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

Kf4ttciw2TCnpHAUYzFXTg.text: Fabulous food! fabulous view!The perfect date place in all of London! You absolutely can't go wrong with this choice. The food was amazing and so were the attentive servers. I went to excellent restaurants all over London and Oxo was hands down the best! A must for everyone especially visiting from the US!

8R13DPbBSydoRODHdpsEzA.text: Ah the tinkling piano, the extensive back bar, the food porn menu (that's just the bar food!), I felt like I was in an Audrey Hepbourn movie... the large wide screen tv on the wall jolted me back into the 21st century.Great views, great staff, veeeery expensive but then it was always bound to be.It pays to be smart in a place like this, or, you could turn up in your casual outfit and act like YOU don't have to dress up for the Oxo tower, both will work just fine.

FTIVqbI8Xu7pOB0iXqorog.text: So this place is located on the eighth floor of the OXO Tower, located on the South Bank, London, OXO's has a spectacular terrace that is breathtaking views of the city.I think you would describe this as pan-Asian and modern British cuisine. The ambiance is nice when you first arrive and it truly sets a tone, which got me sort of excited. As soon as my friends and I sat down we noticed that everything is so close and tight, so close that we could basically be listening to either sides conversation and it would be like we are part of there party! As you look around you see this throughout the place.  We started out with drinks, how can you go wrong with drinks.... Well this staff did. Each of our drinks were screwed up somehow. then we ordered we finally got down to what they wanted us to order because almost everything was out on the menu when we went to ask for something. It was nutzzzz! If I go on any more I may start crying....no I will actually be laughing insanely because the evening was so absurd I couldn't believe it, non of us could.    The Service was very attentive maybe that's why our bill was so pricey great service and crappy food. Mmmmm maybe I can live with that....lol NOT... I will say the best part was entering into the establishment maybe i will give them an off night, They did have some great Bread luckily I at a lot of that. Cheero!

7MPpEHmKJhWvUYsDqdtwRw.text: my sister had her wedding here and it was amazing. food, drink and service! the view from the balcony on to the thames is also amazing and was good for photos.

90UnlVTgnFe8JDhOb1twfA.text: Looking at the previous reviews I would have to agree with most of what's been said about the OXO Tower Brasserie. The views are the thing here and I've attached a couple that I took on my mobile so that you can decide for yourself. It was extremely busy when I went and our table was right next to the musicians. The music was obviously loud but, funnily enough, we didn't have a problem hearing each other and the conversation was not shouted out. The service was good. We never got into that situation where you're craning your neck desperately trying to get someone's attention and our waiter was particularly nice in advising me what I could do to indulge my smoking habit without having to trek all the way downstairs. Unfortunately, the food was a let down. It my be called Thai Fusion but really it was a hodgepodge of flavours that didn't neccesarily go that well together. I think we all agreed around the table that our main courses were okay but a bit disappointing. We spent about £200 between 5 of us for 2 courses each and 1 bottle of wine for the whole evening. However, with the good music, fantastic views and excellent service I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

ri2_iAFMcieb2d81m-mwpQ.text: Food great but cramped and very loud restaurant. Do not go here for a quiet dinner.

961Zn-O215jXY-WkfpibeQ.text: Great food, but I have a feeling you'd get better service if you looked like a model. Be ready for fashionistas in mini skirts and hooker heels.

DdA_FthZ9L1ZXHGGZIVUwg.text: I enjoyed a romantic evening with my girlfriend before a West End show. The view is amazing. The service was above average, but not perfect. The food was very good, but very small portions. I think you can do better for the price. I prefer smaller, quaint restaurants off the main path. You are definitely paying for the view. I think I will not go back here, but will look for a smaller more romantic restaurant next time. If you want to make a impression on a date with an amazing view and good food, then this may be the place. If you are a foodie and the quality of the food is the most important thing to you, I think you should keep looking.

fWKPJUBKShhuNPbcOsDOUA.text: Everything was just outstanding.  We got the duck for two, and it was so tender and flavorful.  Our cocktails were delicious.  They have fine wines by the glass.  The dessert was inventive.  The service was spot on.  Every table has a great view looking down on and across the river.  Please note that they have 2 venues, a restaurant and a brasserie, one on each side of their elevator, and we dined at the restaurant.  We are really looking forward to dining there again, the next time we're in London.

3N1oj0PH4aiK-s-0LtYpFg.text: Ooohh, Oxo Tower... wine me, dine me, make me Yelp! Despite all of the hype, the views from this 8th floor "tower" are in fact stunning, and the prices aren't nearly obscene as anticipated. Oh, it's pricey yes... But I was expecting the final bill to be far more breathtaking than the view, and I'm pleasantly surprised to report that it was quite the opposite. (It really is a damn fine view.)Granted, a winter's evening isn't exactly the best time to en-jo-jo-jo-jo-joy the p-p-p-p-p-atio, but at least I didn't have to beat out the crowds that prevented me from gawking at the Thames and beyond on a lazy summer's night. Put your sparkle pants on, ignore the abundance of extra zeros you're bound to see next to each dish, and take it all in. What's life without a few splurges now and again, right?

d4ujn81WhftbpxhmVe24qg.text: Cliched nouvelle cuisine and an over-enthusiastic wine waiter spoilt the oxo tower for me. I felt was as rushed as if I'd been in McDonald's. Having ordered cocktails, we weren't allowed to finish them before our starter arrived, while eating it the wine waiter began harassing us to choose wine for the meal. He then bought said glass of wine while we were still drinking our cocktails. Good Christ man! I thought. In olden times you would've been shot!The starter was very good- crab and passionfruit, but my main of duck was uninspired to say the least. Won't be coming back.

B1WQeOJmCsMHf3voF_J8SA.text: Getting to the Oxo Tower Brasserie was a bit weird. My sister, wife, and I walked here one night in October and everything between the London Eye and Oxo Tower was dark and pretty empty. We followed the map and got to a seemingly quiet high-rise residential area with closed shops on the first floor. We walked down an empty hall, and took the elevator up.What a difference. From the top floor, the view of London is simply amazing and the brasserie was bustling. When you get to the top, you'll see the brasserie to the left and the restaurant to the right. It kind of makes you feel cheap for going to the brasserie, but don't worry, the food is fantastic. We got a table close to the edge, so we had an awesome view the whole evening. The whole wall facing the Thames is glass. The layout of the restaurant is a large open room with a lot of tables and chairs. Still a bit (mostly business) casual, but definitely nice.I can't remember what we got, but it was all good. They even have good vegetarian options, but they're on a separate menu, so we had to ask. We ordered a Harvey Nichols Cab (Italian) and it has to be some of the best wine I've had. Too bad it's not sold stateside. However, a couple of other wines I had in Europe somehow weren't as good in the States. I think the ambiance, view, food, and service just make you a lot more receptive.At the end of the meal, we took some pictures on the balcony and closed the night. The prices are a bit steep, especially in USD. Particularly if you order alcoholic drinks, it is very easy to cross into 4-$ territory on the Yelp system. However, if you're a tourist and looking for a more upscale or trendy place for dinner, Oxo should be part of your list.

r_Xp6BXa_dpp4xLtBn-bfg.text: Oxo tower, has THE best views of London you can find from a restaurant. We were seated along the balcony and had beautiful views of the waterway. The crowd was very young. Almost a bit of the upscale night club kinds of people. The maître d was extremely professional. The only complaint I had was the fact my duck was served a bit too over cooked and was a bit dry. But at this restaurant, you are paying for the name and view so I can't complain. The bill came out to £400 for 4 people, which isn't too bad. If you're looking for great views, and a young modern atmosphere, but could care less about quality of food, OXO tower is for you.

ZArfmYt_CC0PHGFma3ZMMA.text: People take this place a little too seriously, and I think it takes itself pretty seriously as well. I'm guessing that's why expectations are so high - put the view aside and this is just a standard good restaurant. Don't expect too much from it despite the presentation, Oxo is not in the Michelin guide. If you want to be blown away, go to a Robuchon or the like.The food was good, choices were a bit weird but my wife and I liked what we got. The wine list is impressive although it's overpriced even for a restaurant. There are a few rarities here, like a 1964 Louis Roederer in magnum form, and some choice Dom vintages. The bar is impressive as well, providing very well made drinks. The waitstaff was also doing well by us, providing good suggestions. Not the sort of seamless experience you'll get at a restaurant of Michelin Star caliber again, but good.I think we will return to mark having lived here 6 months, and see what it's like during the summertime.

AIcWPd5bBWM73xXeXdD0Iw.text: This was a really fun place to end my month abroad. The view was spectacular and the atmosphere felt elegant without being stuffy. We met a bartender who was also from the States, which was a warm welcome. We had steak and a lobster dish and shared an appetizer and a bottle of wine. We also started with a cocktail each (two people). While everything was very good, the bill was about $300, which I thought was a little steep given that I wasn't blown away with the food. Don't get me wrong, I have no complaints about the food, I just didn't think it was worth quite as much as we spent. If I had a fatter wallet, I'd come here all the time. My point is, if you have some extra cash to blow at a restaurant, go to OXO Tower. If you're counting pennies, maybe hold off until you've saved up a bit.

CXQr4AdpR-aU1Ndk3N1_PQ.text: We had lunch here only because the place we wanted to go was close that day. We are certainly glad we went here instead! It was one of our first meals in London, so it was great to be so high and can see the London scenery! I was such a tourist taking pictures of the Girken, the London Eye, Big Ben and more. And the lunch was great too. I had duck two ways with bok choy and this was wonderful. There were a lot of textures with simple, yet delicious spices. My husband had the salmon which he enjoyed as well. Atmosphere was somewhat nautical and the service was great. My husband asked about an artwork on the wall and the waitstaff didn't know, but they googled and researched it so they can come back and provide the history and background. :)

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Duck two ways with bok choy

OTWPn5IwyRxc1iJi_z50Wg.text: I can't say that this is the sort of place you would normally catch me in but it has got some definite strong points:The view from the tower is fantastic and worth a trip there almost in itself.You can get absolutely top notch food here - that is without doubt.And there's a great variety to choose from.The downside is, of course, as everyone points out: the price. Hey, c'est la vie, baby! If you don't want t pay that sort of price, why are you going there? There's always McDonalds.Nevertheless, the price would actually stop me going again but if I was a richer person than I am, I would be tempted to go sometimes, when I find myself in London.So, if you don't mind paying the price, go and check out this excellent venue and its top notch eateries!

95dHzJ-XwR43kbpPAoSXNA.text: Despite living in London for the past 10 years, a good view of London never ceases to amaze me. I love London at night as the evening sky makes all the horrid cranes and scaffold that never go away disappear leaving a flawless view.I've always been a fan of the OXO Tower not only for it's collection of great design shops but for the building and its nostalgia of a bygone era of the Thames.Right to the nitty gritty. My lovely boyfriend booked us for dinner at the restaurant (yes I'm very spoilt by him!) and he got a great deal on Lastminute.com for 3 course for £30. Before going I had a look at the sample menu and overall it isn't as expensive as I thought it would be considering it's location. The staff are impeccable and the service is great. The whole meal was delicious but if I'm honest the main was a little small, beautiful to look at but I did find myself pining for a little more as I finished.The decor is uber trendy and again the view really makes this restaurant. I think I would definitely come back for cocktails and I would like to try the Brasserie. If you have overseas friends or family to take out in London this is  a good place to bring them for a slap up meal and good view.

sRqO1gzPOGqLv2Yv7v0qug.text: Excellent food, excellent staff, and an even better viee of the city. The cod was great, and I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice upscale place to eat on the Thames.

nzD04yPPs4FzJ9-eDC1X0Q.text: Visited with high expectations... Extreme let down, particularly by the service. The food is unique and flavorful, nice views depending on your table... But the staff was cold and our waiter did not visit is once after taking our order.  A tremendous disappointment as we were celebrating a special occasion but did not feel welcomed or valued by the staff.  I would have rated them a 1 star, but bumped it up to 2 because of the food.

GuJodXbdn9pbvrUVnqO2Mw.text: We hadn't been here in years.In fact, the last time was when we were young. Back when going out for dinner was the start of the big night, not the actual big night itself.This time we had a seven year old in tow and had just been to the Tate Modern to wonder at the convergence of Art and Performance. It was lunch. And we looked forward to being home in time for The Cube and tucked up in bed by 10.It's Easter and it felt like a treat and we had enjoyed the Oxo tower and its beautiful views all those years ago. So we booked up and got into the Brasserie.Pleased to report, the only thing that's changed is the skyline that affords such a wonderful view of the centre of our great city. Last time we came, there was no Gherkin, no Shard, no mad building to the south with three giant fans at the top of it. Plenty more then to admire or get angry over depending on your point of this view. Table by the window, what more could you want? We had the Concrete monstrosity/marvel of the National Theatre to our west, the Old Bailey and St Paul's Cathedral over the river to the north, and if we turned a little more, the Gherkin, the Nat West Tower and all the other newbies just there to the East. Hundreds of years of history combined with all the modernity the City demands at the same time. And Old Father Thames bursting at the seams in the middle of it all providing a pause for breath from the breathtaking.Gaze at all this in buzzy but comfy smart surroundings with a pianist playing the grand piano and a singer accompanying with some of the old classics.The food almost seems irrelevant. Except it's not. It's never going to beat the stunning views and ambiance, but it gives it a damn good try. I had the quail. A Thai effort with crispy shrimps decorating the edge of the plate all the way round. I prefer my quail cooked a little more harshly but the whole thing was nonetheless lovely. The paw paw salad provided a tangy contrast. The missus had the lamb merguez sausages with the most delicious accompaniment of red pepper muhummara which I'm guessing is crushed nuts of some sort. it added a wonderful texture and flavour to a sausage that, again, could have been treated with a little less respect and maybe have bolder spicing too. The feta cheese added a richness that made this a real dish. Great start.For the main I ordered the cod simply because i saw the lady eat it on the table next to me and it looked so vibrant and crispy skinned and moist. And so it was when it came. Generous amounts of punchy mushroom and Jerusalem artichoke bathed in oodles of vibrant green herb sauce. Delicious.The missus had crab and saffron risotto. This I must say was a little disappointing. Chalky. rushed I suspect so the inside of the grain hadn't been touched by heat. Shame. The flavour was good but the chalkiness of the rice coupled with the sloppiness of the unabsorbed sauce wasn't pleasant to me.But ho cares. We didn't. We sat and marveled and soaked in the atmosphere while the boy tucked into very nice fish and chips and pretended to be interested in our little nuggets..."the scales of justice they're called...that's the savoy over there, the only road where cars can drive on the right..."etc etc.Service was prompt and friendly and the whole thing was rather a joy I have to say. It was far too cold to sit outside but there are tables on the balcony and on a clear warm evening this must be the most romantic and cool place to eat.I hesitate to use the phrase but this is a real 'destination restaurant'. But they don't take you for a ride because of that. Good food. Great atmosphere. Amazing views. An extremely robust 4 stars. A must for tourist and Londoner born and bred alike to tick off the list for a special occasion.

Quf_3T5YHNtC7A0ZvS57TQ.text: We had dinner here at the brasserie, which is a little less formal that the restaurant but really still quite good. Beautiful, elegant surroundings, with attentive professional service and very nice cuisine.I had the pumpkin gnocchi, which was quite tasty and despite what looked like a small-ish serving, quite filling. My companion had lamb seasoned with harissa, which was also really quite good and with a beautiful presentation.Of course, the reason one eats here is really the view... an absolutely stunning view up the Thames. I always seem to find myself in London, whether it be via layover or happy accident, and look forward to dining here again.

pPtZSK-KpA4iVBl67eJsTw.text: Great spot for a great view of London!  There is a balcony outside where you can stand and enjoy it.The place has quite a classy atmosphere and is a bit on the pricier side but worth it for the view.Take your mates, a date, work collegues, tourists or just yourself!

Usqd-RFyFqiMLyvQ9HDoUg.text: Some work colleagues and I dined at the restaurant awhile ago after a fairly intense work day, punctuated by the fact that some of us had arrived the same day from the States and really just wanted a good night's rest. But who can resist this view? And in an classy (albeit expensive) island away from the hordes. It was a fun and relaxing evening and a great opportunity to catch up. The food was very good and the service was efficient, friendly, and unobtrusive. A few of my friends really enjoyed the wine list too. Then afterwards, we all took a leisurely and happy stroll back to the hotel. Or at least until that one street person took a swing at me with his bottle while passing me by.....Ah London!

TRtCLR250QqZq1Er37VpIA.text: Came by here on my last trip to London. 10-15 minute walk across the bridge from the tube station. Initially we made reservations for the OXO Restaurant, but changed it to the OXO Brassiere since we liked their menu better.  I had the Corn Fed Chicken Breast which was good, but you are honestly paying for the view which did not disappoint. We did have cocktails after at our table which were great, and unfortunately I was visiting in December so sitting outside was not an option. Even though my friend and I are only 20, we both enjoyed the evening at this trendy restaurant and I would recommend coming by here for great views of London if you are visiting from overseas.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Due South cocktail
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Corn fed chicken
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

gD3RC3yVVjSnTtgxBU1pYw.text: My son and I recently traveled to London for vacation in addition to celebrating my birthday!  Our concierge at the "ME" hotel, Emiliano,  recommended OXO for my birthday dinner.... All I can say is WOW!  The service was exceptional, the servers were Manuel and Celine.  They were attentive and extremely helpful with dining suggestions.  The food was amazing.  The presentation, quality of the food and an extensive wine list, made for an exceptional evening.  Needless to say the view of the river Thames is right out of a book.  We celebrated a magical evening at a 5 star restaurant.  Thank you OXO, XOXO

VScvwIkYzqIniOn2LcG5-w.text: Spent the evening here after work. Ate in the Brasserie, where the food was some of the best i've ever eaten, whilst enjoying some live jazz music they had on. We then moved on to the bar where we were given a table with superb views over looking the City and enjoyed the extensive cocktail menu. All staff were real friendly and helpful. A definite 5*

LfZxpgyScxMn1Df9NDIt_w.text: I went to the Oxo Tower restaurant for dinner last night and was really rather disappointed. The service was slow and unorganised and the food was pretty average, given the price tag associated with it. I have been once before around 3 years ago and had a much better experience. We had gone prepared to splash out for the full 3 courses and wine, coffee etc but by the time we'd had our starter and main course and had been waiting for 20 mins for our dessert order to be taken we decided that we had had enough, got our bill and left. We paid £130 for 2 courses each, water and a bottle of wine. There are far better places to spend that sort of money in London and we won't be back.

Bh72WoETXmuvSE9HViYyTg.text: Great views of the River Thames and surrounding buildings in a classic piece of London architecture.

137Js3qihdUDpHs-RHaHIg.text: A great place for dinner & drinks with a spectacular view of London!

xqmrwEnsBrX61vG_k9jc7w.text: Great venue with a nice lounge and restaurant setting.  Great for both just grabbing cocktails and having dinner.  Overall it is on the expensive side for the quality, but maybe to compensate for the view? Next time, maybe a lighter fare or a couple less drinks but I will be back.

gE0UJZ5w4VwasIj0sVwF8g.text: I had heard mixed reviews about the OXO Tower Restaurant and Brasserie but as it was somewhere I had always wanted to go (and we couldn't get in a Fifteen) we recently ended up in the Brasserie there for a birthday celebration. Our table was booked for 9pm (it was a slightly late notice evening out) and we arrived on the 8th floor after a very pleasant walk along the Thames passing the lovely Christmas market at Bankside and taking in the sights. There is a bar, brasserie and restaurant at the OXO Tower - all on the 8th floor and all owned by the Harvey Nicholls Group. A friend had recommended the brasserie as opposed to the more formal (and on a week night apparently quite corporate) restaurant. For the brasserie you head towards the bar and are greeted by very polite staff at the entrance, your coat is taken at the cloakroom and shown to your table. At first I was slightly disappointed by our table as although it was near the window we were directly next to one of the waiters stations and very close to other diners. However once sat down it was fine. The atmosphere in the brasserie was fantasic - although the decor and furniture can make it feel a little clattery -the chatter and live jazz pianist playing Christmas songs more than improved the mood. The service was a little slow to start with - I had heard about the vegetarian menu and wanted to look at it but a waiter was no where to be found for about ten minutes, and our starters came before our wine but this was nothing that bothered me too much. I ended up with both a starter and a main from the vegetarian menu (which is not as good as I had been led to believe - three dishes for starter and main, two of which were already on the normal menu). My starter was quite interesting (tofu with rice pancake) rather than amazing, but my brother said his (lamb shank gnocchi) was fantastic. The mains were lovely - with my only criticism being that my tortellini was covered in a thick shower of cress -I thought I was in the 80's for a moment. The real star of the show food wise was however the desserts - we shared a creme brulee and a cheese plate and both were out of this world. The wine (about £22 a bottle but the house wine was cheaper) lasted us nicely and the bill came to a reasonable £109 for two people. The OXO Tower is a lovely place to eat - the views are stunning across the Thames, the atmosphere is wonderful especially with the Christmas music playing - the food wasn't the best I had eaten ina restaurant but the price was more than reasonable and the service adequate and without any major issues. I would recommend a trip here for an enjoyable, reasonably priced dinner for a special occasion - by no means is this the kind of place you would go for a week night meal (pizza express anyone?) but for my birthday celebration - it was perfect.

yp6GxHGRuRrdnh7zluikKQ.text: Consistently good for the last ten years (at least!), the Oxo Tower felt a little outdated this time around. Choosing the slightly cheaper brasserie, it was packed at 7pm on a Friday night, resulting in our initially being offered a small table for three (we moved after politely asking for a larger table). Service was prompt and friendly, the menu was predictable Conran and the dishes were true to their descriptions. As ever though, you cannot beat the view and even though the sky was overcast, as London lit up at dusk, all the downsides of Oxo melted away.

qvRe8EEcv1-HII9WPYgd8Q.text: Good food, excellent service, nice views.still the atmosphere wasn't quite right.didn't get the luxury feeling one should get with those prices

1tEY4EUIhFfL57bSUVd9YQ.text: Great location looking out over London, I went on business but could well see how this would impress for an evening date. The food is on Thai fusion tip and was good, but not great. I had the Greek Octopus with Feta which was bound to please as I am a cheese freak, however the lobster for main was small and not overly warm. I hate fries that have been reheated/overcooked! No room fro desert although I was tempted by the cheese cake. Go for location and ambience, not for the food.

7o5iYECFL1r3BiYWkZ0hvg.text: who else than me has been lucky enough to be taken to the OXO tower for valentine's day??? well apparently many people as our table was booked for 2hrs and not a minute more. getting a table there will cost you quite a lot of money but it is worth it! phew! what a view!!!you feel that you are at the top of the world and the view over london is quite amazingly stunning!I would say that the food would go over all my expectations but it is still good and exotic and diverse enough to make you forget that it is not the best gastronomie ever.the wine is good and so is the champagne and I don't think there are many things more romantic than drinking your bubbly or your coffee arm in arms and watching the world go on at your feet. definately an amazing venue and one of the most romantic too...

9U3IhiRXwJmu-kn-1RTvZQ.text: A fabulous location and views, whether it be a summer evening or winter with the Christmas lights. The atmosphere is lively and the cocktail bar fun - with drinks placed on uplights at the bar. The food is very good. The one criticism I had was that it felt very crowded with tables too close together. This may be because it was the run up to Christmas and more tables had been added? Despite this, it is a restaurant/bar with the wow factor due to its location and is a great place to take somebody for a celebration.

IOZvgw21r95_IsJ3wdP9Bg.text: We visited the Brasserie for the first time as a special birthday treat, and treat it certainly was. When we arrived the bar was lively and buzzing but not so much that the singer and music couldn't be heard. The staff, who, to be fair, were expecting us, were nevertheless very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. It took some time to make our choices from a very interesting menu. Food was delish. Not somewhere to go for a quiet or relaxing evening!! Far too buzzy!

EclhQxI9-dPLqB6gAho6ug.text: If you want to go to a posh brasserie, that is not tooo pricey, that is on the top floor of the OXO building, that overlooks the river, and that is in walking distance (10 mins) from Waterloo station then this is the place to go. In fact if you don't opt for loads of alcohol then the bill for food is very reasonable given the excellent quality of food. You will need to book quite a few months in advanced, however you may be able to get a table for an early or late sitting if you fancy this. Sittings are in two hour shifts every quarter of an hour or so; you can phone or book on line. Before or after your meal (or both) head to the lively bar area and have a few cocktails, and why not take your cocktail out onto the balcony to get a few pictures of St Pauls or 'The Gerkin' as well as the sites along the Thames. .

O5TZManuno5E5ItvMyDZtA.text: Great food, Great waiters and very helpful, Highly recommended

MuZbEJ7Ie47oKiUjyCGtxA.text: my mate neil recomended this place he said his wife loved it so much they go there every night

pXm2QLnHX7BgqDlJRmbK_w.text: You have to get a lift up to here and it's always quite crowded but it is worth it. This has always been a favourite of mine I take all my dates here. Expensive coctails but very nice ones and you feel like you are in an exclusive bar. There is a viewing area where you get a lovely view of London and the Thames. The only downside was the last time I went it was very busy. We stood and waited for a free table and when one did come we were about to sit down when we were told two other people had reserved it. Not pub etiquette.

M7I-lX2JCPyUnnNfSoVV2g.text: I took my children here in the summer. They loved the veiws and the atmosphere, it was a lovely afternoon sitting outside on the verander. I wasn't however very impressed with the way my children were treated. I have 3 teenagers, all extremely polite and well behaved. They eat out regulaly and have impecable table manners. The waiter came to offer us bread rolls, he was distracted by another diner and left the bread basket on the table. My daughter helped herself to a roll just as the waiter turned round. He was extremely rude to my 16 year old , who was very embarrassed. It was supposed to be the start of a lovely day but this experience left us angry. The meal was expensive but on a positive note, lovely fine dining. We were all happy with our choices.

U3lafwExmQHPr959Xpi6Sg.text: If you take leisurely stroll along the South Bank the OXO Tower stands out. It is an amazing building. While walking towards the tower there are lots things to see eg Globe Theatre and Gabriel's Wharf. The galleries and shops there opens everyday except Monday. There is a platform on the 8th floor where you can enjoy breathtaking views of the Thames and surrounding area. You can also walk up to the refurbished doors to look at the shops, restaurants, galleries, cafes and studios that are in there. It is amazing what an old power station and reprocessing plant can become.

QTEGFkCEgio0qJSmBQaduA.text: For a one off experience then it is worth a try. The views are spectacular granted. But once you've been there once, then there really is little reason to go back again. I had dinner there, and once you have gotton over the - oh isn't the view nice - you are just left with your food. What can I say about that - well, I didn't get food posioning, and it tasted alright, but considering the cost I would have expected something a bit more, well, filling, more choice, something that tasted a bit better. Basically dont come here for the food. For the cocktails, yes, they're great (expensive, but hey cocktails usually are) for the view, yes it's great. But perhaps you may be better off eating out somewhere else and just coming for drinks.

Z3i4g3hSk0HuRNqaG0JPjQ.text: nice plase to go for fun but can be a lil pricy!

uI6p7d4BVQF1B83-j64dig.text: Recommended.Located downtown, near the Eye.  This restaurant is on the eight floor of the building and has a great view of the city.  Weather permitting, I recommend that you sit outside; the noise level inside can get pretty high with all the hard surfaces.  Also, the trendy blue lighting can made reading the menu at night a bit of a challenge.Food was excellent.  I have the Mediterranean lamb, it was very tender and was spiced just right.  Others all enjoyed their orders as well.Good wine list.  Properly made bar drinks.The server was excellent.  The place was very busy but he was always accessible and responsive.  Gratuity is added, it is not optional.This was a special night out with my wife and two Goddaughters and this restaurant did not disappoint.Total tab for four with drinks was about $346 dollars.  Skip the drinks to save or be prepared with your gold card.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Sea bass at the OXO

kHuv4skldi79or1s40_IaA.text: Lovely place to have lunch with friends, so we did! Exceptional views, with  an affordable set menu that included a nice glass of white wine. Two of our options was a delicious, nicely portioned, Salmon Salad, which I and my friend had and the other two ladies in our group had  huge bacon cheeseburgers served with fries. One of our diners didn't get her bacon on her burger, opps...oh well, we still had a lovely time.

ftmIPRQ1cnI2XzgO8gTQoQ.text: OXO Tower features a high-end restaurant, brasserie, and bar. The restaurant is a lifestyle experience crafted by Harvey Nichols. A place to see and be seen.The OXO Burger is a luxury take on the burger featuring a bun loaded with poppy seeds + sesame seeds, pickles, Monterey Jack cheese, crispy bacon, caramelized onions, spring mix, and juicy beef. The blend of ingredients creates a very satisfying flavor, and the beef is pretty juicy and flavorful by itself. The flavor profile is well balanced. It manages to highlight each ingredient with a taste that changes from first bite to chew to aftertaste. This makes the burger a very exciting experience for the taste buds. It's hard to call any one ingredient stand out on this burger, but my favorites were definitely the bacon, onion, pickles, and cheese (I liked almost everything about this one). Compared to the best burgers in the world the only thing holding this burger from easily being near the top is the bun. The abundance of sesame and poppy seeds did not seem necessary, and the bun was a little dry. With the addition of a pillowy soft bakery bun to this burger it might be the best in London. If you need an afternoon drink, or a place to impress a date OXO Tower is the place to go. While you are there enjoying one of the best views in London also try one of the best burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. OXO Burger

QZ6cQvPfES4u051tfZv7pg.text: The food was creative but not ground-breaking. The cocktails (and mocktails) were solid though a bit floral. What really set the OXO restaurant apart was location (gorgeous river views), quality of service, and a 100% wheelchair friendly building. This will become a regular stop along my South Bank tour for London visitors.

1hAHroQnvHJGKNSIGQgDqw.text: Enjoyed the Spring Menu at the brasserie for lunch.  The view is wonderfully expansive, the restaurant a bit upscale business crowd.  Except for the average starters (just slightly overdone pork belly and a pedestrian gazpacho) the food was very good.  Our entrees were both delicious - the duck confit was perfectly rendered, spiced, and crisp, and in the find of all restaurant finds the accompanying salad with chili corn salsa contained popcorn(!) - and it worked perfectly, slightly salty, slightly sweet and not damp or chewy.  The pasta arrabiata was correctly al dente and full of salty, earthy goodness, well stocked with olives and veggies.  We finished with mango brulee and a chocolate pavlova, both yummy.  Service was professional and the meal appropriately leisurely paced so as to enjoy the view.Taken all together, the view, the food and the service, its a worthwhile indulgence

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Duck Confit and Salad with Chili Corn Salsa (yes, that's popcorn and it was amazing!).

OkA1d7b0sS8xFwI8XwwdNg.text: After visiting St. Paul's Cathedral, The Tate Modern and taking a tour of The Globe Theater, we had worked up quite an appetite.  I pulled up Yelp to look for a great place to dine that we could walk to in short order.  Oxo Tower is only a ten minute walk along the Thames from The Globe.  We headed in that direction to dine at the Oxo Tower Restaurant.The restaurant occupies a very large space on the eight floor and is all windows on the Thames side of the restaurant.  As you can imagine, the view is spectacular and having shown up for a late lunch, the light was perfect.  The restaurant was relatively quiet as lunch had passed and we were in the space between mid-day and dinner.  As we walked in, I realized we had discovered a "not-inexpensive" lunch spot.  We were seated right at the window and so a fantastic late lunch experience ensued.  Lunch consists of a prix fixe choice of starter, main and dessert.  We started with the Field Mushrooms, Root Vegetables and Rosemary and Blue Cheese Cookie.  The presentation was impeccable, the mushrooms were tender, parsnips were perfectly crispy and the Blue Cheese was delightful.  Our choice of main was the Fillet of Beef, Cauliflower Puree, Jerusalem Artichoke, Parsley and Garlic Potatoes.  The beef melted in my mouth and the garlic potatoes were to die for.  For dessert, I chose the selection of cheese and my daughter had the selection of sorbets.  I highly recommend the cheese dessert.  They roll out a cart with eight or nine different types of cheeses...you have the option of selecting your cheese or you can allow your server to make the selection for you, which I decided to do.  He recommended a wonderful port to accompany the cheese.The service was on par with what you would expect for a Michelin Star restaurant in my opinion.  The food was consistently memorable and the ambiance was lovely.  Highly recommended.

xIuWRzp3_9l2Cfkqo6BVZg.text: Absolutely love the Oxo Tower restaurant! It's quite easy to book a table (can do it a few days in advance normally) but I certainly would advise booking.You get 2 hour slots for the table but they normally are a little flexible with this.If the weather is nice they have an amazing balcony where you can sit out and eat. The views of the river and St. Paul's are breathtaking! They have a great selection of drinks and food. The food menu does change relatively often. I'd recommend a chocolate pudding; they're always delicious! The staff are really attentive. Only slight negative was sometimes they apologise for their presence, which was a bit unnecessary. Otherwise they're fab! It's quite pricey but for a special occasion I would thoroughly recommend.Don't mix the restaurant up with the brasserie; they are two different places!

l6Gyc0Eji-VVtAjirdlEmg.text: I think I definitely had a better impression of the food the 2nd time around.  The 1st time I had dinner in the restaurant but this time we were in the brasserie.  It was for a relatively large party so we had a limited set menu.  I had the moroccan lamb sausages to start which were very tasty.  For the main course, I had the fried pumpkin gnocchi which was delicious!  I really enjoyed this dish and would def go back again for it.  For dessert, I had the chocolate tart which melted your mouth.  Beautiful views of London.

zhSx-LzJXIePFZiVD9wj3Q.text: You really can't beat the view can you?Upscale business dining experience.  Wonderful service and wonderfully cooked food. From the moment we were seated, until the coffee after dessert..everything was perfect. I reccomend the lamb chops - beautifully cooked.  And for an appetiser; I really can't forget the haggis. There was some crunch, a little moistness..the haggis reminded me of a really really good kebeh. Wil come back, on another date night.

4IC6wFj6BASmL8jOab0lzA.text: A great spot for lunch or dinner.  The food is great but the real attraction is the view.  The restaurant and brasserie both offer a fantastic view of the London skyline.  I booked a table a few weeks in advance for a special occasion and requested a table around the edge of the restaurant (view) and was told there was no guarantee, upon arrival I had the best seat in the house.  All in all a very accommodating restaurant with tasty food.

NJy6hvmJORyKRokFd05nLQ.text: The OXO tower rocks.For any actual or aspiring artist, any cafe-loving walker, and any local or international tourist who loves a view, OXO delivers.Most people review the restaurant, but the building the restaurant inhabits carries much more than a bar & brasserie. There are clothing and jewelery stores, cafes and little kitchy catch-all shops all throughout the first two floors.Every time I visit London, I like to go to OXO, not only to eat, but to shop. Centrally located on the banks of the Thames, it's a stones throw from Tate Modern, the London Bridge, the Eye and boasts wonderful views of the city across the water.Definitively go to OXO to eat - as the reviews here suggest - but also consider heading there in the afternoon, while on your way to a matinee, to pick up a unique gift, browse through artisan jewelery and grab a latte.T.

HI3X-VxshSJBFNcjLvT17g.text: There is definitely better dining in London for cheaper! I expected more from the Oxo Tower. The lobster soup was just mediocre and the lamb wasn't as tasty as I had hoped.If you're looking for a nice ritzy place, come here. The view of London is also breathtaking.

FJF0thli_BVC0DTPhomT_A.text: We had dinner at the lounge/brasserie, by the window.View is gorgeous and romantic (but maybe it was the company ;)The live music was okay--two men playing string instruments and the piano was left empty unfortunately.We got the beef carpaccio to start (delicious!), Sea Bass and Suckling pig. The sea bass was fried and accompanied by curry sauce, which was not as good as I thought it would be, but not bad. They ran out of the suckling pig and replaced it with pork chop, which turned out to be really good.

SFV4lcn8TcVH8Cbw7d8v1g.text: Everyone says the view from OXO Tower Restaurant is the star. While that may be true, we both agreed that the special infused gin and tonics they served were the best we'd ever experienced. Husband had cucumber / rose and I had lime / strawberry. Don't miss them!The food was good, as was the service. But get there for sunset and soak in the view.

hGdi9UNVHvT-ORZm2mwfvQ.text: A little fusion flavor anyone...I tried the lunch at Oxo Brasserie.  It was delicious. Great view probably the best in London, and great attentive staff.The butter for their bread is excellent. It is very inviting and you will find yourself asking for more bread...-Chilli spiced pumpkin miso soup, soba noodles, tofu (7 pounds)* A mild tasting miso with very finely diced up pumpkin. Different but good-Japanese beef carpaccio, wasabi mayonnaise, teriyaki onions, shiso cress (11 pounds)*Very good light, but very flavorful beef carpaccio. The wasabi mayo adds a different element.-Sea bass, pumpkin fritter, bok choy, red curry sauce, coconut sambal (23.50 pounds)*Very flavorful because of the curry coconut. Very rich and damn good.-Charcoal grilled cajun bourbon marinated corn-fed chicken, slaw, crispy pancetta, barbecue sauce, corn bread (21 pounds)*I am not sure if this dish was suppose to be served warm - cold.. It is very tender and rich. Good chicken taste with a hint of char..-Twice cooked Maris Piper chips (3.75 pounds)*Disappointed in the advertised twice cooked chips. It was super soft in the middle of the chips. Steak cutIMPORTANT NOTE: OXo Tower has the Czech Republic beer - Budweiser Budvar - Very few places will serve that outside of Czech. It is a must order, and you can thank me later..

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom

w2noa0gtDWKunMs3hPfZXw.text: I had a friend visiting London from the US, so wanted to have a good dinner with a view.  I was quite excited with all the reviews of the food and reviews.  So I think the views are good (not great), booking was easy and the table allocated was outdoors without any fuss and the service staff are wonderful and attentive. All of us agreed that the starters were AMAZING! My favorite was the bresaola, don't think I have had anything to match it thus far.Now here are the negatives:- My friend was a whiskey fan and he ordered from the list we were given.  The waiter returned after 15 minutes to tell us that they had just ran out of the one he wanted.  He ordered a second, and guess what, after 15 minutes, we found out they had 'just' run out of that as well.  Third time it worked, and it got us off to a bad start.  No fault of the waiter, just a bad experience.- While everyone raved about the starters, everyone was unanimously unhappy with main and the dessert.  The flavor combinations were just jarring at times, and you had to have a drink to wash the taste off.  On the Middle Eastern Mezze, the falafel was simply lacking any seasoning (salt) and the spices were just not coming through.  The mint yogurt was lacking flavor as well, as I would not have guessed it had mint had I not read the menu.  - I had the raspberry and yogurt panacotta and the raspberry tartness was just so overpowering that the panacotta and the dessert-ly creaminess was completely lost.  Thank god I had water nearby.Overall, I WILL return for an evening and just have the starter and some drinks and leave.  Not risking it with the mains and dessert, not for the prices listed.

fsf5nkPPF-VMuexs4lzR5w.text: All course were delicious and waiter/bar staff/maitre d'e were all exceedingly helpful! Was a surprise for my girlfriend and fair to say she had a brilliant time. A little pricey but you pay for the great food, wine, service & views - worth every penny

FN4BIyNpR2TFFcoS7l_BgA.text: OXO tower is a lovely place to wow a friend, date, out of town guest.  The view is spectacular and there is a buzz in the air from the moment you sit down.  The food is quite nice and the service decent also.  My only gripe (and they can't help this)...it's a little cheesy and I got the sense that a lot of tourists were there.  It didn't feel like a local gem.  I don't think, however, that bothers the OXO tower or most of the diners there.I would definitely go back if I had someone in town.

6wnb-naYEGHXzM5ZNU0AJw.text: Great views and perfect location for a sunny day. The food was as good as you'd expect, but I don't necessarily think 'oh yes, Oxo Tower!' when trying to find a nice restaurant in London.

dtqZ_pk4DqkeKBLJNslZFw.text: The Oxo Restaurant is a superb place to dine for so many reasons.  First, the location is quite central (Southbank, near Waterloo and the Tate Modern).  And, as such, the views are spectacular - overlooking St Paul's.  The food is sublime.  My friend and I dined there tonight and did a bookatable deal for 3 courses and a cocktail for £30, which is a phenomenal deal, especially at this venue.   At first I was worried that the food wouldn't be up to par, but have no fear - it was delicious.  The quality and presentation of each course was impressive.    I really loved each dish, particularly the wild boar ragu with potato gnocchi - amazing!  The service was excellent and the views were spectacular.  I would return in a heartbeat.

tWvUAyb4H4E6KWMmmzpM_g.text: Accidentally stumbled upon a pop up at the oxo yesterday - garden gate. Themed and with great views over London.There's games - connect 4, Jenga - all life size and deckchairs to relax.Cocktail wise this place excels.. Such a wide choice.. I went for the pink lemonade complete with a touch of vodka to liven it up. It was nice and not too sweet. Priced at 6.50.. Very reasonable for central London.Food wise the menu lacked excitement.. It could definitely use work. Was slightly tempted by a black bean burger, but decided to just stick to cocktails.Great concept, will definitely visit again, but probably just for the cocktails and games.

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Parasol condiments
Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. Pink lemonade

h5WAUmKn5YxkGYuULyXPUw.text: Had afternoon tea here and it was so enjoyable! We had a great view of the river along with delicious tea, finger sandwiches and desserts! Don't leave without tasting the scones!

rpTxnDMphdFe_3DZkW49iA.text: I always wondered what was in the OXO Tower....I wonder no more.Located alongside the southbank took a while for me to find the actual entrance as there is a lift that takes you straight up to the restaurant/ bar.As soon as I walked in i was greeted by a lovely hostess who was very accommodating and even managed to find us a table outside on the terrace. The great service stopped once we were seated.The drinks selection is great but nothing to rave about.However the views is what this this place is best for.We never tried any food but the restaurant side of the establishment was constantly busy.The only main downside is that its a little bit on the touristy side so I probably wont go again as i was not that impressed.

xpdrJ42_pKMIv5qzPUMhyw.text: I am not even sure where to begin with this review. You may think you are going to the restaurant just for the view of the North City, but you could not be more wrong. This place is a top notch fine dining experience. We had the set menu and the options were plentiful. The beef fillet was incredible with the ravioli. The wine list is amazing and let's not forget about the dessert. One word people: CHOCOLATE!! This place is a must if you enjoy elevated city views with exceptional food!!

photos.caption: Photo of OXO Tower Restaurant - South Bank, London, United Kingdom. View from the outside balcony

-qpvDhU67G8AesD__Vi9Zw.text: wow. WOW. just wow. Amazing food, service, view, desserts were meh, but who cares, the rest of it was great. We started the meal with the scottish langoustines, avocado puree, coconut and vanilla. By gawd it rocked my world. We're still talking about it to this day.Don't remmwber what our mains were because it was totally over shadowed by the starter. Oops! Helluva meal!

P_8EztQQ65tQQI9oKY67Dg.text: Very good restaurant, but the view is even better. Just had a 2 course meal and was completely stuffed with a smile on my face. Started with the salmon poached egg and spinach soup. Incredible creation never had seen this before. And the taste beautiful. Main course the dry aged pork ribeye. Nice fatty and tender and came with potato mash and black pudding. Really good taste. We ordered extra fries, but these were not needed.The service is passing by many times. To much I would say. The french greetings they had were chic, but I rather hear english.Overall good night out.

4nErMC_RMBI4s4NJYNwTEA.text: We went here to celebrate my grandmother's 80th birthday with a dinner for 9. With glass windows surrounding the restaurant, there really isn't a bad place to sit as all spots provide you with a vast view of the city.All of the staff was truly wonderful, making my grandmother and guests feel very comfortable and at home.The food was delicious! If trying the bread, I highly suggest the rosemary with a pat of butter. The rosemary isn't overpowering and butter has just the right amount of salt.I had their pork belly which was a nice portion, well cooked and beautifully plated. I also had the sea bass which was fresh and put upon a bed of crispy kale, octopus and chorizo. For dessert I ordered the sorbet of which the elderberry was my favorite (a flavor not readily utilized in NY food).The only things to comment upon other than there markable food and staff is that it can get particularly warm, and I believe my seat was near the heat source.  Also, while it's completely understandable, larger parties are limited to a particular menu. This limitation may keep you from experiencing other things on the menu you may have wanted to try. If you do go with a large party, those things can be added without issue.If you have something or someone special to celebrate, I highly suggest the Oxo tower when in London. It's great for large groups, but also serves well for romantic dinners and business meals.

66TGrFfA6EM4LSVSnHeAPg.text: Best steak I've had in a while. It was tender and tasteful, perfect amount and great garnish. Great view, great food, attentionate waiters. It's one of those "posh" places that people talk about, so we were really looking forward to it. The greeting area, the champagne and the view lives up to all one can expect, I can highly recommend it. For some reason we were not allowed to go out on the patio, even if that was clearly allowed on the patio next to it, the one they call brasserie - it was full of people. The strange rules and our desire to challenge the system gave us and some other guests the opportunity to play some fun games with the staff. "Sir, you are not allowed to go out there!". "What?". Sir, come back!". (silence), "Sir, I must insist that you and your party come back in". "Why?" "Sir, (deep sigh), we have been over this already, allow me to clarify...". And so on. Good times. And the view is really good.The wine list is good, but the waiters seem to know nothing about grape-based alcoholic beverages. I asked for guidance in choosing a white, but all I got was "This is Italian". "This one is from New Zealand", etc. I have been able to read for many years, I'd even go so far as to call myself literate. So that was, well, literally no help.But I'd come back for the steak.

uoIetAVyvhkY2jegbxu_iA.text: Had a lovely dinner here to celebrate our anniversary. Views are amazing even on a winter's evening when all we could see were the lights.The food was great, and the elderflower and elderberry meringue with lemon curd ice cream was the stand out dish.The only things that could be improved was the service - waiting staff were incredibly quick to the point that it all felt a little rushed. Waiter also told me that the chef wouldn't be 'too happy' that I wanted the duck slightly more well done than they usually serve, but when we're the ones picking up the bill I don't think that should be a problem.

toGgv0nk_ZSN83ubLAe29w.text: The food is not worth the money.  Your paying for the view, My husband ordered a lamb chop and expected a big lamb chop not a. Any lamb chop but even so most restaurants give a bunch.  He had a rack of 3 baby chops attached by fat, not nearly enough for a man for dinner.  On the side there was a pastry with brisket which was tasty but the whole meal not a great sized portion for what you pay.  My meal was a decent sized steak but I had to send it back to get the true medium instead of being raw on the middle, it took a while waiting.  I would not go back. XCxd3sTOCXc5UpNgsH3dwQ.text: How to make you feel like you were on a 3 weeks vacation? Just go somewhere for the weekend. This time I went to London, and it was quite worth it !On Sunday lunch, my friend and I decided to go to OXO. We asked to sit at the restaurant, not the brasserie. Because the weather was quite warm and sunny at times, we dared to sit outside... And were the only ones :DOne star for the spot : Amazing location. The terrace is overlooking the river Thames and from there you can only hear the sound of the waves. It's so relaxing we actually forgot about the time... One star for the service : Beautiful service overall. I did not have to read the menu, the waiter took the time to explain it all beautifully. It was a if he was telling a story. The waiting time was reasonable. One star for the food : Everything was fantastic. As you can see from the pictures I uploaded, the presentation is sophisticated but simple. From starter to dessert, from champagne (as aperitif) to the wine, the entire meal was a dream. One star for the drinks : The sommelier was very helpful in finding us the perfect compromise. He advised us on a Pouilly Fuisse, white wine. Simply perfect, I highly recommend it. One star for the experience : The location, service, food, and drinks were top of the range. I could not have wished for a better place to have lunch on Sunday in London. The price reflects the level of service but still reasonable. A five star rating for OXO Tower Restaurant. If you have the chance, treat yourself for a one of a kind lunch :)

Zgcq2-ERM8vwbzsFkkG_bQ.text: This is getting three stars for the view. First of all, my fiancé had booked our reservation online at the brasserie for 7:45. When we got there, there was a sign saying it's been closed for a private event and that our reservation was for 9:45. Obviously something got messed up during the reservation process. So they sent us across the way to the other restaurant and we waited until they were able to accommodate us (about 9:20). The service was unbelievably SLOW. And forget about asking for some almonds to munch on they'll forget. We constantly had to flag down a waitress for drinks it seemed like we were being very neglected. When we were finally seated, it took over an hour for our appetizers to come out and almost another hour for our meals to come out which the steak was cooked to medium when my fiancé asked for rare. We were there for over three hours. Not by choice. I got the duck which was very tender and delicious. The rum baba with coconut sorbet was AWESOME. If this place were a dessert place is given it 5 stars, but it's not. Overall it's a nice modern fancy restaurant with mediocre food, unbelievably slow service and a great view.

dg01VIMjN1BivKAYIbyhUg.text: Never having been to South Bank before, I made a reservation at Oxo Tower for a Thursday night to try their Winter prix-fixe menu in the brasserie. Finding this restaurant was a scavenger hunt in itself since this whole area was under construction. When I finally saw the 'OXO' sign up on top of a building, I figured I must be at the right building. I wandered around a bit to find the lift and made my way up to the 8th floor. I was greeted very nicely by the host, they took my coat, and promptly walked me to my table which was right up against the glass. I had a lovely view of the Thames River, Blackfriars Bridge & St. Paul's in the backdrop. Absolutely stunning! My friend and I both went with the prix-fixe menu for 29.50. The names of the dishes are escaping me at the moment (sorry), but I can tell you the gist. For my starter, I had the onion soup with duck confit, which was very flavorful and quite delicious. I nearly licked my bowl clean because it was so good. My main, scottish cod, was cooked to perfection. My fish was flaky & tasted amazing, and wasn't heavy at all. For dessert, I had the apple pudding & custard. This was the icing on top... it was a great way to end my meal. I was basically in dessert heaven. My friend ordered different things where I only got to have a bite of: veal and beef ragout, linguine, and the rhubarb and vanilla brulee. I want to say that all of my choices were better based off the bites I had.The food is pretty good, but come on... everyone and their mums are here for the view. It's gorgeous & a very nice atmosphere to have a lovely dinner. It was my first time on South Bank in this area so it was nice to see the lights from this side of the Thames. I had a lovely time and the venue and the view is worth giving this restaurant a try.

yA_Cp_7sJOpxU_6vk6QqZw.text: We had a great experience at OXO restaurant. We'd booked online from the USA a few weeks ago. We booked early because we were going to see a show beforehand which finished around 5pm. We went for a bit of a walk and arrived a little early. We had a seat on the patio in the bar area and had a drink there before being moved to our table which was also in the patio. My husband is very white and forgot his sunglasses, luckily the staff had him covered there and bought over a pair of glasses for him. He's still pretty sunburnt though! I ordered the crab to start, followed by the pork chop, hubby had the sucking pork to start followed by a steak. We got new potatoes and broccoli as sides also. All of the food was delicious and cooked well. Hubby's steak was a bit pinker than medium rare in the middle but he was fine wit that. Unbeknownst to me, they had previously arranged a birthday surprise for me! I came back from the bathroom and was presented with a very rich and decadent personalised chocolate cake for two (which actually feeds 4) with some cute little candles on it! They asked it we would like it served and the rest in a box which was very appreciated. It was far too big for 2 of us to eat! The service was impeccable but the one thing I will say is that it would have been great to have some light music playing outside. It was very quiet aside from people noise.

8S5EpTLM925o5LLpl3ds1g.text: The views are fantastic, and the ambience is really nice.  But the food wasn't great.  The squid appetizer was chewy, and for my main I got the sea bass - which was over cooked and dry.  My wife got the lamb, which was also unimpressive.We were a big group (25), so they required us to rent out a private space and commit to a minimum spend at the bar... by the end of our meal, we were still $1,500 pounds under our required tab -- they wouldn't let us buy a gift card for another visit, they wouldn't let us buy any bottles of wine or champagne to go (meanwhile they did sell box sets of spirits, bottles of nice wine, champagne, etc), and they wouldn't let us buy anyone else's dinner.  So we just lost out on the money, which is pretty crazy. Disappointing experience overall.

IFHIwcoHN8I9ZFturv81Gg.text: Pricey food with a drinks menu that is a lot bigger than the food menu, but what a view you'll have most days. Even the quintessential gloomy London days are beautiful as you get to see the River Thames and the city lights across the way after the Sun goes down, (which in London is early during the colder months).Reservations are strongly recommended, and do be prepared to splurge. The cocktails are amazing, though, and they always have something seasonal to put you in the spirit of whatever the time of year it happens to be. The portions are small, but fancy. And the staff is quite friendly.Maybe not the kind of place you visit on a weekly basis, but certainly worth a try at least once for a special occasion. Do try to get a seat on the terrace if the weather permits. It's quite lovely.

It would have been nice to have space heaters around to keep us warm. I could tell the servers were cold by subtle things but I guess space heaters for restaurants hasn't come around to London yet. I might be wrong, I don't know.The Grey Goose Le Grand Fizz was great. You could barely taste the vodka unless they didn't put much in to begin with... Who knows. The bread and butter was also great. 1q5OjW2exbg1iRtanoh53A.text: I'm actually around a 4.5 stars myself, but sadly The Yelp Elves don't seem to have that function coded in.I had a meeting with a recruitment agency earlier in the day and a dear friend picked me up at Somerset House so we could stroll leisurely towards the Oxo Tower for a late lunch. As ever, my dining companion has great taste when it comes to picking out eating establishments .. so huzzah!I felt a bit scruffy compared to some of the suits in attendance, but as always, it's now how you look but how deep your pockets are which truly counts. We had a lovely leisurely lunch, some great dishes, the serving staff were polite, pleasant and not overly intrusive.We were sat by a window overlooking the Thames - and it was a lovely view, especially on a sunny afternoon.I would recommend Oxo Restaurant. Lovely, crisp & clean premises, very well cooked food, staff pleasant  and not intrusive and we were given the delightful benefit of being able to linger over our food.
